intro: Clematoclethra lasioclada var. grandis, commonly known as the large-leaved alderleaf, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its alternate, ovate to elliptical leaves that are typically dark green on top and lighter underneath. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers in clusters, usually pink to red, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds. This species thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in woodlands and stream banks.
